Maintained and extended Rails based video management and distribution system.

item.title: The Next Opportunity (2014 edition)
item.description:
EDIT: I’m not looking. This post stays here for posterity.

I’m looking for my next opportunity. Ideally, the company is in San Francisco. I’m open to remote work, but I’d much rather participate with a team directly. Here are some thoughts on what this next role looks like.

item.title: Moving On
item.description: Eighteen months after I began working on Blujack I find myself in the unfortunate position of having to move on. It goes without saying that things didn’t go according to plan. Bootstrapping a startup requires a significant amount of personal risk. That risk has become too much for me to bear. As I now meet this fate it is crucial to learn as much as possible from the experience and move on to something new.

item.title: R√©sum√©
item.description: R√©sum√© of Darren Boyd 1026 Page St. San Francisco, CA 94117 Mobile: (310) 869-3109 darren.boyd@gmail.com darrenboyd.github.io Experience Blujack Technical Co-Founder San Francisco, CA July 2013 ‚Äì present Co-founded Blujack; responsible for the technical obligations of the blujack group travel management product. Built out Blujack's product with Ruby on Rails. Managed a small team of developers and helped develop mobile applications using Cordova, shipping on Android and iOS. Integrated with third-party APIs to add realtime flight status, flight search and flight confirmation-email parsing to the Blujack system.

item.title: Elixir
The Rails Stack
item.description: This is a quick overview of what the Rails stack looks like in a typical production environment.

item.title: Ninefold
item.description: I decided to spend some time playing around with the hosting service from Ninefold. Their offering looks great, with excellent pricing. They seem as simple to use as Heroku, but you can still get to control an actual server. Signup is easy. They give you 30 days before requiring billing information. After the 30 days, you still get the first $50 waived. It’s a very frictionless activation process, and well worth the effort to get a ‘machine in the cloud’.

item.title: Hello, is this thing on?
item.description: I’m trying this blogging thing out again. I heard it’s popular. That’s assuming I can find a way to write something compelling. I believe that means I need to practice at it :). Props to contributors of Jekyll as well as Jekyll Now. Props to contributors of Hugo and the Kiss theme.

item.title: About Me
item.description: This page is some personal thoughts. Details about about my career on can be found on my work page. I’m a software developer, gamer, guitar player, husband, and genuinely nice guy üòÅ. Work is Play My career is in software development. My hobbies, for the most part have looked very similar to my day job. Not surprising given the programming obsession took hold at age twelve. My Commodore VIC-20 attached to an old black-and-white television and I could not be parted.

item.title: My Work
item.description: I’m one of those lucky people who discovered early on in life that I could make a career doing what I love ‚Äê developing software. With a few exceptions, my work has focused on building online applications. Below are a few notable highlights and accomplishments. The Early Years I was fortunate enough to work for my first startup while in college. Western Computer Link was an Internet Service Provider during the mid-90s growth spurt of the Internet.
